item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 2:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Dobble (The Mathematics Of) (2018) (14 points | 1 comment)
2. The Principles of Mr. Harrison's Time-Keeper (15 points | 1 comment)
3. Audio Decomposition – open-source seperation of music to constituent instruments (134 points | 34 comments)
4. Mind-Bending Soviet Era Oil Rig City on the Caspian Sea (74 points | 19 comments)
5. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (507 points | 60 comments)
6. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (520 points | 157 comments)
7. 19th Century Map Shows a Fictional Country Created by a Con Man (16 points | 5 comments)
8. NYC Subway Station Layouts (239 points | 70 comments)
9. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (103 points | 22 comments)
10. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (146 points | 21 comments)
11. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (229 points | 86 comments)
12. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (377 points | 77 comments)
13. Linux Asceticism (6 points | discuss)
14. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (134 points | 66 comments)
15. Ask HN: Where to put a static page that would last forever (25 points | 31 comments)
16. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (31 points | 1 comment)
17. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (203 points | 116 comments)
18. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (80 points | 23 comments)
19. Measuring keyboard-to-photon latency with a light sensor (2023) (24 points | 9 comments)
20. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (310 points | 47 comments)
21. When machine learning tells the wrong story (188 points | 15 comments)
22. Physical Intelligence's first generalist policy AI can finally do your laundry (150 points | 112 comments)
23. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (26 points | 2 comments)
24. Grim Fandango (251 points | 82 comments)
25. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (107 points | 11 comments)
26. Texture-Less Text Rendering (198 points | 49 comments)
27. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (206 points | 83 comments)
28. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (189 points | 74 comments)
29. Notes on Guyana (157 points | 111 comments)
30. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (142 points | 73 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 2:10 PM UTC
